sections.title: Introduction (Wide Shot)
sections.content: Hey, I’m Jihad Al Sayed, and in this video we’re breaking down how to describe the complete set of solutions to a system of linear equations. Whether the system has no solution, one solution, or infinitely many — we’ll cover it all.

sections.title: Types of Solutions
sections.content: There are three types: no solution (inconsistent), one solution (unique), or infinitely many solutions (dependent). Understanding the structure helps us decide how to proceed.

sections.title: Example: Infinitely Many Solutions
sections.math: \begin{bmatrix}1 & 2 & | & 5 \\ 2 & 4 & | & 10\end{bmatrix} \Rightarrow \text{One row is a multiple of the other} \Rightarrow \text{Free variable → Infinite solutions}

sections.title: Recap
sections.content: We explored solution types: unique, none, and infinite. Understanding how to interpret row-reduced matrices lets you confidently describe the solution set of any linear system.
